title: Charges dropped against Falmouth 18-year-old accused of planning school shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The "suspicious" male seen at a local elementary school was actually not Fotheringham, according to his lawyer.

By Molly Farrar September 25, 2025 | 7:06 PM 1 minute to read Prosecutors dropped the charges against an 18-year-old accused of threatening to “shoot up” a Cape Cod school and showing up at an elementary school last month, officials said.
Ian Fotheringham, of Falmouth, was initially charged with threatened use of a deadly weapon in a public building.

title: What Brad Stevens said about Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "The most important thing is a fully healthy Jayson Tatum.
” Jayson Tatum suffered a torn Achilles four months ago.

Barry Chin/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 25, 2025 | 6:28 PM 2 minutes to read Jayson Tatum was staring at a long road back to the hardwood in May after he ruptured his Achilles tendon during the Eastern Conference Semifinals against the Knicks.

title: Boston to offer free COVID and flu vaccines at more than a dozen locations
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News All of the clinics will provide free flu and COVID-19 vaccinations, and some will offer routine vaccinations for children five and older.

By Sana Muneer September 25, 2025 | 5:47 PM 1 minute to read The Boston Public Health Commission is partnering with several community organizations to provide free vaccine clinics around the city, the commission announced Wednesday.

BPHC teamed up with Boston Public Schools, Boston Centers for Youth & Families, and community organizations to launch the clinics in late September before the climax of the respiratory virus season, the commission said in a press release.

title: URI men’s rugby club team suspended over hazing allegations
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News "The men's club rugby team may not represent the University in any organized competition, practice, or scrimmage.
" The University of Rhode Island sign at Upper College Road, the main entrance on campus.

Sean McVeigh/URI By Molly Farrar September 25, 2025 | 5:14 PM 1 minute to read The University of Rhode Island’s men’s club rugby team is suspended for the academic year after an investigation into hazing allegations, the school said.

title: Hunter dies in Connecticut after falling from tree, police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News The man, whose identity has not yet been released, was pronounced dead at Baystate Medical Center.
By Sana Muneer September 25, 2025 | 5:00 PM Less than a minute to read A hunter died Tuesday evening after falling from a tree in Connecticut, police said.
Enfield EMS, police, and fire responded to 54 Weymouth Road around 7 p.

title: What to read: Dark academia starter pack
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Books At the heart of dark academia is a simple premise: when knowledge becomes obsession, something – or someone – must break.
Once a niche literary aesthetic, dark academia has evolved into a fully-fledged subgenre that blends mystery, tragedy, and intellectual obsession with the aesthetics of elite academia.
(Photo collage by Annie Jonas/Boston.

title: South End restaurant named one of the most influential in U.S., according to Eater
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Food News The restaurant "remains an essential Boston restaurant: still a party in a town that knows how it’s done,” according to Eater.
Paella Valencia at Toro in Boston's South End.

Dina Rudick/Globe Staff A South End restaurant, which features Spanish-style tapas, a curated wine list and cocktails, was recently named one of Eater’s most essential and influential restaurants in America over the past 20 years.

title: Zdeno Chara rejoins Bruins as Hockey Operations Advisor and Mentor
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins “Having played alongside Zdeno, I know firsthand the leadership, work ethic and professionalism he brings every day.
" Zdeno Chara is rejoining the Bruins in a new role.
Barry Chin / The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 25, 2025 | 2:39 PM 2 minutes to read Zdeno Chara is back with the Boston Bruins — albeit in a different role this time around.
